CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Stanislav Shevchuk;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in LOC .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG against a private company , PERSON , for non - fulfilment of its contractual obligations , under which it should have provided the applicant with agricultural products .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG left the applicant ’s complaint without consideration , holding that it fell within the jurisdiction of the commercial courts .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed that ruling and remitted the case for a fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claims as unsubstantiated .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed that decision and remitted the case for a fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found in part for the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld that decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of ORG , following an objection ( протест ) lodged by its President , quashed the decisions of the lower courts and remitted the case to ORG for a fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the PERSON company lodged a counterclaim with that court seeking the annulment of the contract .

After DATE the case was reconsidered by the courts at CARDINAL levels of jurisdiction on QUANTITY occasions because the courts of first instance and appeal had committed factual and legal errors in their decisions .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG allowed the applicant ’s claim in part and ordered the successor of the PERSON company , GPE , to transfer QUANTITY of potatoes , worth CARDINAL NORP hryvnas ( ORG ) , and QUANTITY of wheat , worth UAH MONEY , to the applicant . It also ordered the applicant to return QUANTITY of meat , worth UAH CARDINAL , to GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld that judgment . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal in cassation .

CARDINAL . In the course of the proceedings CARDINAL hearings were adjourned , CARDINAL of which were adjourned due to the applicant ’s failure to attend and the remaining CARDINAL due to the need to call witnesses or due to their or their respondent ’s failure to attend .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the Bailiffs started enforcement proceedings in respect of the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG modified the procedure of enforcement , ordering the GPE company to pay the applicant ORG CARDINAL for the products due to him under the judgment of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , following a request by the ORG company to modify the procedure of enforcement of the judgment of DATE , ordered cross - cancellation of the debts under that judgment in the amount of ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL and ruled that ORG was to pay the applicant ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL . The ruling of DATE was not appealed against and became final .
CARDINAL . On DATE the judgment of DATE was enforced in full .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against the GPE company , seeking compensation for the difference between the award paid and the in market prices of the products due to him under the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claims as unsubstantiated .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed that decision and discontinued the proceedings in the case , holding that the issue had been settled by the final judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case for a fresh consideration to ORG , before which it is still pending .
